Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Â We had a room facing the river, on the 4th floor. All perfect, the room was clean and modern, quiet as we wanted it to be. The restaurant is good, bery well maintained and respecting anti-covid mesures: limited self service, all waiters wearing the masks, strict hygiene, some products sealed in plastic (like a portion of fruit salad). Overall, great experience, we were very pleased. In addition, it's super central, right next to the oldtown and Oder river. Wasn't overcrowded.
Negative_reviews: Â I personally dislike the hotels with closed sealed windows, when you can't open it, and are forced to rely on the AC. I don't like sleeping with AC turned on, as it gets easily too cold, and you can catch something. This is a big disadvantage, the night sleep was very mediocre.

TV has good channels, plus one channel just only about Wroclaw and hotels Plaza. Housekeeping was very good.

Title: Comfortable at riverside

Positive_reviews: Â The location was great, the hotel itself was very clean and close to the old town and other popular places of intrest.
Negative_reviews: Â When we first checked in, the lady who was checking us in at first was quite rude. She asked for my passport or ID card. Iâ€™m Canadian but Iâ€™m a permanent resident of Germany. Canadians are not allowed to travel to Poland at the moment so I was trying to give her my EU ID. She had no patience at all (my Eu Iâ€™d was in my wallet In my backpack)and was telling me to just give her my passport this was enough, if I had known that I would have done so right away. However as we stayed here on our way to Slovakia a week prior and was required to show my residence permit this is why I was getting it ready for her. She took my documentation and gave us our room keys. We went to the room, everything was pleasant and nice. However when we left I informed the lady at checkout we had three items from the mini bar, one cola, one vodka and one jack Daniels. I paid and just as I was about to leave her phone rang and she told me â€œmy colleague said you had two vodkasâ€. I said ok maybe my husband had one and I paid for it and left. Once my husband and I left the hotel I asked him, he said he did not have any vodka at all. I went back to explain this and the lady who was there checking me out was no longer there. I tried to talk to who was at the reception but she didnâ€™t understand me. So we left. It was probably a mistake with the Pepe who rented the room before us, or a housekeeping mistake regarding the vodka. We know we didnâ€™t have it, we paid for it anyways. Despite this one issue the hotel was great and we would stay again.

Title: great location, good view from the room

I also complain about people in the restaurant speaking very loud and sometimes in a rude tone, nobody making them any remark (both Poles as foreigners).
